intro: Henslowia hookeri, commonly known as the Hooker's henslowia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, with upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in whorls along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
